result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Michael Hendon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW hearing 12/18/2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 36.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered.  Bail on deposit to apply, if any.  Remainder to be paid during period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order; and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim until one half (1/2) of the Batterers Treatment is completed and unless approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Complete Batterers Intervention Program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Michael Hendon

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Court had issued authorized a warrant earlier but the defendant is now here in court.  Agent left and was ordered to contact the agent.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Case was calendared for a jury trial today.  The defendant wants to change his plea.
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered the "Repeater" enhancer dismissed as to count 1:
As to count 1 as amended:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued..
.
As to count 1:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 20 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 40 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim until 1/2 of the Batterer's Treatment is completed, and unless approved by the agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36 on 12/18/2015 at 01:30 p.m.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant's Notice of Alibi received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
 Final pretrial conference held.  The district attorney is still trying to obtain medical records and they are asking for an adjournment.
State files an amended complaint charging count 1, "Misdemeanor Battery, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater", pursuant to Wisc. stats. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a); and count 2: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, pursuant to Wis. stats. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 973.055(1).
Jury trial date of 09/28/2015 is vacated.  The court grants the state's request for an adjournment.
 Case calendared for another jury trial date in Branch 36.
  Jury trial scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab
Received & Filed, Justice Point Violation: Missed Telephone Contact. Transfered to Br. 36.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in court PRO SE. Case is adjourned to allow additional time for defendant to retain counsel. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Court tolled substitution time limits until next court date. Case adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Sheila P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Christopher Michael Hendon in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. 
Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  
IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
